page.title: 09Ropley Choir & Bellringing
page.content: Ropley church has 6 bells.The lightest bell weighs 1/5 of a tonne & is called the treble.The heaviest is the tenor, it weighs 3/4 of a tonne.We practice each Thursday 7.30-9.00 and Rodney Skinner teaches us.There are about 6 adults & 9 children in the group.I have been learning for about a year. I usually ring the treble or 2. Choir practice night is Wednesday 6.15 -7.30 for juniors & 7-8 for seniors. Mrs Longlands is organist & choir mistress.I have been in the choir for 3 years.When you join you get a card of tests & you work your way through them.When you join you get a white surplice & then as you pass tests you get different coloured ribbons - light blue,dark blue & finally red.I have got my red ribbon.Senior choir members have a grey ribbon.
